Detailed Description

template<typename KEY, typename VALUE, typename PAIR_TRAITS = pair_traits< KEY, VALUE >, typename TRAITS = split_list::type_traits, class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
class cds::map::SplitOrderedList< KEY, VALUE, PAIR_TRAITS, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >

Split-ordered list.

Hash table implementation based on split-ordered list

Template parameters:
  • KEY Key type stored in list
  • VALUE Value type stored in list
  • PAIR_TRAITS <KEY, VALUE> pair traits. See cds::map::pair_traits template for detail
  • TRAITS Split-ordered list traits. See cds::map::split_list::type_traits for detail
  • ALLOCATOR Memory allocator. Default is std::allocator
Source:
[2003] Ori Shalev, Nir Shavit "Split-Ordered Lists - Lock-free Resizable Hash Tables"
Split-ordered list can be resizeable or not. If TRAITS::bucket_table is cds::map::split_list::dynamic_bucket_table that is default then the list is resizeable and may increase dynamically. The constructor calculates upper limit of dynamic bucket table based on its arguments - maximum item count expected and load factor.

If TRAITS::bucket_table is cds::map::split_list::static_bucket_table then the list's bucket table is static and cannot grow. The size of bucket table is calculated during construction time based on maximum item count expected and load factor.

The item counter (TRAITS::item_counter_type) type cannot be cds::atomics::empty_item_counter. Counting of items in the list is important part of split-ordered list algorithm. The default implementation cds::map::split_list::type_traits uses interlocked cds::atomics::item_counter class for this purpose.

Depend on garbage collection (GC) schema of underlying ordered list implementation (TRAITS::ordered_list_type) split-ordered list may support item removing or may not. If GC of underlying ordered list is cds::gc::no_gc, then the split-ordered list is not support item removing, for any other GC the list is support item removing.

See cds::map::split_list::details split_list_impl specializations for description of map interface.

Note: for ordered list based on cds::gc::tagged_gc memory reclamation schema the shared free list is not supported.

Implementation notes
The library automatically selects appropriate implementation depends on garbage collector used. See Map common interface for description of map interface.
